segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites for Stand-alone and Configuration Manager Integration Topologies

segment.source: Before starting the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) installation, you must complete the prerequisites listed in this topic.
segment.target: Before starting the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) installation, you must complete the prerequisites listed in this topic.

segment.source: These prerequisites apply to the MBAM Stand-alone topology and System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: These prerequisites apply to the MBAM Stand-alone topology and System Center Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.source: If you are deploying MBAM with System Center Configuration Manager, you must complete additional prerequisites, which are listed in MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology.
segment.target: If you are deploying MBAM with System Center Configuration Manager, you must complete additional prerequisites, which are listed in MBAM 2.5 Server Prerequisites that Apply Only to the Configuration Manager Integration Topology.

segment.source: For a list of the supported hardware and operating systems for MBAM, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.
segment.target: For a list of the supported hardware and operating systems for MBAM, see MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations.

segment.source: If BitLocker was used without MBAM, you must decrypt the drive and then clear TPM using tpm.msc.
segment.target: If BitLocker was used without MBAM, you must decrypt the drive and then clear TPM using tpm.msc.

segment.source: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM if the client PC is already encrypted and the TPM owner password created.
segment.target: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM if the client PC is already encrypted and the TPM owner password created.

segment.source: Groups created in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)
segment.target: Groups created in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)

segment.source: See Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts for a description of these groups and accounts.
segment.target: See Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts for a description of these groups and accounts.

segment.source: Install Microsoft SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.
segment.target: Install Microsoft SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.

segment.source: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.
segment.target: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.

segment.source: SQL Server instance login server roles:
segment.target: SQL Server instance login server roles:

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights:
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights:

segment.source: Optional - Install the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) feature available in SQL Server
segment.target: Optional - Install the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) feature available in SQL Server

segment.source: The TDE SQL Server feature performs real-time I/O encryption and decryption of the data and log files, which can help you to comply with laws, regulations, and guidelines that apply to various industries.
segment.target: The TDE SQL Server feature performs real-time I/O encryption and decryption of the data and log files, which can help you to comply with laws, regulations, and guidelines that apply to various industries.

segment.source: TDE performs real-time decryption of database information.
segment.target: TDE performs real-time decryption of database information.

segment.source: This means that, if you are viewing recovery key information in the SQL Server database and you are logged on under an account that has permissions to the database, the recovery key information is visible.
segment.target: This means that, if you are viewing recovery key information in the SQL Server database and you are logged on under an account that has permissions to the database, the recovery key information is visible.

segment.source: To read more about TDE, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: To read more about TDE, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.source: SQL Server Database Engine Services must be installed and running during MBAM Server installation.
segment.target: SQL Server Database Engine Services must be installed and running during MBAM Server installation.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on the Recovery Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on the Recovery Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.

segment.source: Prerequisites for the Compliance and Audit Database
segment.target: Prerequisites for the Compliance and Audit Database

segment.source: Install SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.
segment.target: Install SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.

segment.source: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.
segment.target: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.

segment.source: SQL Server instance login server roles:
segment.target: SQL Server instance login server roles:

segment.source: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights:
segment.target: SQL Server Reporting Services instance rights:

segment.source: Optional - Install the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) feature in SQL Server
segment.target: Optional - Install the Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) feature in SQL Server

segment.source: The TDE SQL Server feature performs real-time I/O encryption and decryption of the data and log files, which can help you to comply with laws, regulations, and guidelines that apply to various industries.
segment.target: The TDE SQL Server feature performs real-time I/O encryption and decryption of the data and log files, which can help you to comply with laws, regulations, and guidelines that apply to various industries.

segment.source: TDE performs real-time decryption of database information.
segment.target: TDE performs real-time decryption of database information.

segment.source: This means that, if you are viewing recovery key information in the SQL Server database and you are logged on under an account that has permissions to the database, the recovery key information is visible.
segment.target: This means that, if you are viewing recovery key information in the SQL Server database and you are logged on under an account that has permissions to the database, the recovery key information is visible.

segment.source: To read more about TDE, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: To read more about TDE, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.source: SQL Server Database Engine Services must be installed and running during MBAM Server installation.
segment.target: SQL Server Database Engine Services must be installed and running during MBAM Server installation.

segment.source: However, SQL Server can be running remotely; it doesn’t have to be on the same server on which you are installing the MBAM Server software.
segment.target: However, SQL Server can be running remotely; it doesn’t have to be on the same server on which you are installing the MBAM Server software.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on the Compliance and Audit Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on the Compliance and Audit Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.

segment.source: Install SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.
segment.target: Install SQL Server with SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS collation.

segment.source: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.
segment.target: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.

segment.source: SSRS must be installed and running during the MBAM Server installation.
segment.target: SSRS must be installed and running during the MBAM Server installation.

segment.source: Configure SSRS in native mode and not in unconfigured or SharePoint mode.
segment.target: Configure SSRS in native mode and not in unconfigured or SharePoint mode.

segment.source: SSRS instance rights – required for configuring Reports only if you are installing databases on a separate server from the server where Reports are configured.
segment.target: SSRS instance rights – required for configuring Reports only if you are installing databases on a separate server from the server where Reports are configured.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on this Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell does not have to be installed on this Database server if you are using Windows PowerShell to configure the database from a remote computer.

segment.source: Prerequisites for the Administration and Monitoring Server
segment.target: Prerequisites for the Administration and Monitoring Server

segment.source: The following table lists the installation prerequisites for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.
segment.target: The following table lists the installation prerequisites for the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Server.

segment.source: This role must be added to a server operating system that is supported for the Administration and Monitoring Server feature.
segment.target: This role must be added to a server operating system that is supported for the Administration and Monitoring Server feature.

segment.source: Click IIS Management Scripts and Tools.
segment.target: Click IIS Management Scripts and Tools.

segment.source: To secure communication between the client computers and the web services, you must obtain and install a certificate that a trusted security authority signed.
segment.target: To secure communication between the client computers and the web services, you must obtain and install a certificate that a trusted security authority signed.

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 .NET Framework 4.5 is already installed for these versions of Windows Server, but you must enable it.
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 .NET Framework 4.5 is already installed for these versions of Windows Server, but you must enable it.

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 .NET Framework 4.5 is not included with Windows Server 2008 R2, so you must download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 and install it separately.
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 .NET Framework 4.5 is not included with Windows Server 2008 R2, so you must download Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5 and install it separately.

segment.source: If you are upgrading from MBAM 2.0 or MBAM 2.0 SP1 and need to install .NET Framework 4.5, see Release Notes for MBAM 2.5 for an additional required step to make the websites work.
segment.target: If you are upgrading from MBAM 2.0 or MBAM 2.0 SP1 and need to install .NET Framework 4.5, see Release Notes for MBAM 2.5 for an additional required step to make the websites work.

segment.source: The web applications require an SPN for the virtual host name under the domain account that you use for the web application pools.
segment.target: The web applications require an SPN for the virtual host name under the domain account that you use for the web application pools.

segment.source: If your administrative rights permit you to create SPNs in Active Directory Domain Services, MBAM creates the SPN for you.
segment.target: If your administrative rights permit you to create SPNs in Active Directory Domain Services, MBAM creates the SPN for you.

segment.source: See Setspn for information about the rights required to create SPNs.
segment.target: See Setspn for information about the rights required to create SPNs.

segment.source: If you do not have administrative rights to create SPNs, you must ask the Active Directory administrators in your organization to create the SPN for you by using the following command.
segment.target: If you do not have administrative rights to create SPNs, you must ask the Active Directory administrators in your organization to create the SPN for you by using the following command.

segment.source: In the code example, the virtual host name is mbamvirtual.contoso.com, and the domain account used for the web application pools is contoso\mbamapppooluser.
segment.target: In the code example, the virtual host name is mbamvirtual.contoso.com, and the domain account used for the web application pools is contoso\mbamapppooluser.

segment.source: If you are setting up Load Balancing, use the same application pool account on all servers.
segment.target: If you are setting up Load Balancing, use the same application pool account on all servers.

segment.source: For more information about registering SPNs for fully qualified, NetBIOS, and custom host names, see Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites.
segment.target: For more information about registering SPNs for fully qualified, NetBIOS, and custom host names, see Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites.

segment.source: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.
segment.target: See MBAM 2.5 Supported Configurations for supported versions.

segment.source: The web applications require an SPN for the virtual host name under the domain account that you use for the web application pools.
segment.target: The web applications require an SPN for the virtual host name under the domain account that you use for the web application pools.

segment.source: If your administrative rights permit you to create SPNs in Active Directory Domain Services, MBAM creates the SPN for you.
segment.target: If your administrative rights permit you to create SPNs in Active Directory Domain Services, MBAM creates the SPN for you.

segment.source: See Setspn for information about the rights required to create SPNs.
segment.target: See Setspn for information about the rights required to create SPNs.

segment.source: If you do not have administrative rights to create SPNs, you must ask the Active Directory administrators in your organization administrators in your organization to create the SPN for you by using the following command.
segment.target: If you do not have administrative rights to create SPNs, you must ask the Active Directory administrators in your organization administrators in your organization to create the SPN for you by using the following command.

segment.source: In the code example, the virtual host name is mbamvirtual.contoso.com, and the domain account used for the web application pools is contoso\mbamapppooluser.
segment.target: In the code example, the virtual host name is mbamvirtual.contoso.com, and the domain account used for the web application pools is contoso\mbamapppooluser.

segment.source: If you are setting up Load Balancing, use the same application pool account on all servers.
segment.target: If you are setting up Load Balancing, use the same application pool account on all servers.

segment.source: For more information about registering SPNs for fully qualified, NetBIOS, and custom host names, see Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites.
segment.target: For more information about registering SPNs for fully qualified, NetBIOS, and custom host names, see Planning How to Secure the MBAM Websites.

segment.source: Before installing the MBAM Client, download the MBAM Group Policy Templates from How to Get MDOP Group Policy (.admx) Templates and configure them with the settings that you want to implement in your enterprise for BitLocker Drive Encryption.
segment.target: Before installing the MBAM Client, download the MBAM Group Policy Templates from How to Get MDOP Group Policy (.admx) Templates and configure them with the settings that you want to implement in your enterprise for BitLocker Drive Encryption.

segment.source: Before installing the MBAM Client, do the following:
segment.target: Before installing the MBAM Client, do the following:

segment.source: Copy the MBAM Group Policy Templates
segment.target: Copy the MBAM Group Policy Templates

segment.source: Copying the MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Templates
segment.target: Copying the MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Templates

segment.source: Editing the MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Settings
segment.target: Editing the MBAM 2.5 Group Policy Settings

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
